oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Paul's Lutheran Church, circa 2001
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of St. Paul's Lutheran Church located at 1628 Eighth Avenue North in Nashville, Tennessee. The church was built in 1936 and appeared in city directories with an original address of 1630 Eighth Avenue North. The foundation is made of rough cut limestone. The walls are composed of red brick. The roof is gabled with tar shingles. The windows were originally slightly arched, but are now square with stained glass. The doors are wooden. Special features include simple buttresses with stone accents, and an ornamental cross on the front facade. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: St. Paul's Lutheran Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
